required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Baricitinib in Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Bioequivalence and Food Effect Study in Healthy Subjects Comparing Baricitinib Suspension and Commercial Tablet Formulations

brief_summary.textblock:
The purposes of this study are to determine:
- If there are any differences in the amount of baricitinib in the blood/body when taken in two different forms.
- How a high-fat, high-calorie meal affects the amount of baricitinib in the blood/body.
- The safety and tolerability of baricitinib.
The study has two parts. Individuals will participate in only one part.
Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) and will be discharged from the CRU following the completion of 3 overnight stays.
Each part of this study will last from 8-10 days, not including screening. Follow-up will occur 7 to 14 days after the last dose of baricitinib.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Observed Drug Concentration (Cmax) of Baricitinib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through 48 hours after administration of study drug in each period

primary_outcome.measure: PK: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve from Time Zero to the Last Time Point with a Measurable Concentration (AUC[0-tlast]) of Baricitinib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through 48 hours after administration of study drug in each period

primary_outcome.measure: PK: Area Under the Concentration versus Time Curve from Time Zero to Infinity (AUC[0-∞]) of Baricitinib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through 48 hours after administration of study drug in each period

arm_group.description: Baricitinib suspension administered orally without water when fasting.
Baricitinib suspension administered orally with water when fasting.
Baricitinib tablet administered orally with water when fasting.
Baricitinib suspension test formulation (TF) administered when fasting.
Baricitinib suspension TF administered after a meal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Are overtly healthy males or females, as determined by medical history and physical examination
- Women not of child-bearing potential
- Have a body mass index (BMI) of 18.5 to 29.9 kilograms per meter squared (kg/m²) inclusive, at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received live vaccine(s) within 3 months of screening, or intend to during the study
- Have a current or recent history (less than [<] 30 days prior to screening and/or <45 days prior to Day -1 in Period 1) of a clinically significant bacterial, fungal parasitic, viral (not including rhinopharyngitis), or mycobacterial infection
